dimacs.name: DIMACS Implementation Challenge - Network Flows and Matching (1st Challenge, 1990-1991)
dimacs.terms: Benchmark data appears to be in the public domain and freely available for educational and scientific use. Published materials may have additional AMS (American Mathematical Society) restrictions. Users are requested to acknowledge the source and notify DIMACS of usage for documentation purposes.
dimacs.redistribution: Allowed for educational and scientific purposes with proper acknowledgment
dimacs.citation: Johnson, D.S. and McGeoch, C.C. (Eds.). Network Flows and Matching: First DIMACS Implementation Challenge. DIMACS Series in Discrete Mathematics and Theoretical Computer Science, Volume 12 (1993).
dimacs.notes: License or copyright restrictions may apply to published volumes through AMS.

or_library.name: OR-Library (J.E. Beasley)
or_library.terms: Test data sets can be used by students and teachers for operations research purposes. Proper acknowledgment and identification of J.E. Beasley as the author is required.
or_library.redistribution: Allowed with attribution to J.E. Beasley
or_library.citation: Beasley, J.E. OR-Library: distributing test problems by electronic mail. Journal of the Operational Research Society 41(11) (1990) pp1069-1072.
or_library.notes: Users should consult the legal page for specific restrictions. Contact Professor Beasley through Brunel University for detailed terms.

lemon.name: LEMON (Library for Efficient Modeling and Optimization in Networks)
lemon.terms: LEMON is released under the Boost Software License, Version 1.0. Permission is granted, free of charge, to any person or organization obtaining a copy of the software. Code without explicit copyright notice is covered by this license.
lemon.redistribution: Freely allowed for commercial and non-commercial use
lemon.citation: Péter Kovács. Minimum-cost flow algorithms: an experimental evaluation. Optimization Methods and Software, 30:94-127, 2015.
lemon.notes: Part of COIN-OR project. Very permissive license requiring copyright notices with source code distributions. Benchmark data generated with NETGEN, GRIDGEN, GOTO, GRIDGRAPH and from real-world sources.

commalab.name: CommaLAB - Computational Mathematics Laboratory, University of Pisa
commalab.terms: No explicit license terms stated. Site is described as 'a service to the optimization community.' Various datasets are attributed to specific researchers.
commalab.citation: Varies by dataset - cite original researchers (Frangioni, Gendron, Castro, Vance, etc.)
commalab.notes: Attribution appears necessary for datasets. Some instances (GARR, SNDLib) derive from real-world networks. MMCFBlock component is part of open-source SMS++ project. Contact CommaLAB for explicit redistribution terms.

network_repository.name: Network Repository (networkrepository.com)
network_repository.terms: Attribution required for any public use. Must provide link to license and indicate changes. If remixing or building upon material, must distribute under same license. Dataset-specific citations must be honored.
network_repository.citation: Varies by dataset - see individual dataset pages for specific citations
network_repository.notes: Public domain elements exempt from license requirements. No warranties given. No additional legal/technological restrictions may be applied.

cv_western_ontario.name: Computer Vision Research Group, University of Western Ontario
cv_western_ontario.terms: No explicit license terms found. Instances are maximum flow problems from computer vision applications.
cv_western_ontario.citation: Cite original research papers that generated the instances
cv_western_ontario.notes: Used as basis for some LEMON benchmark instances. Verify current availability and terms with University of Western Ontario.

netgen.name: NETGEN - Network Flow Problem Generator
netgen.original_paper: Klingman, D., A. Napier, and J. Stutz. NETGEN: A Program for Generating Large Scale Capacitated Assignment, Transportation, and Minimum Cost Flow Network Problems. Management Science 20.5 (1974): 814-821.
netgen.generates: Capacitated/uncapacitated minimum cost flow, transportation, and assignment problems
netgen.notes: No maintained Python ports exist. Original Fortran/C versions available. Modern implementations on GitHub/PyPI are independent reimplementations.

gridgraph.name: GRIDGRAPH - Grid-based Graph Generator
gridgraph.notes: Part of DIMACS generator suite. Specific download link to be determined.

requires_contact: OR-Library (verify current terms with J.E. Beasley)
CV Western Ontario (verify availability and terms)
summary.recommendation: For MVP, focus on DIMACS and LEMON benchmark instances which have clear, permissive licenses. Use download scripts rather than committing files to repository. Always include proper attribution.

metadata.purpose: License audit for Phase 1 of benchmark suite development
metadata.disclaimer: This document represents research findings as of the last verified date. Users should verify current license terms directly with source organizations before redistribution or commercial use.
